Her sodium was low, her potassium was low, her BUN and creatinine were elevated, which suggested dehydration. We started her well on IV you know fluids right there in the clinic, and I sent her to the emergency room for more aggressive hydration. She ended up getting two liters of IV fluids in the ER, and they monitored her for a few hours. This is clearly an adverse reaction to the Ozempic. The timing is too coincidental - started the medication, three weeks later, severe GI symptoms. We've ruled out other causes. The patient had no history of GI issues before this.
